gobblin.writer.http

Class SalesforceRestWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.instrumented.writer.InstrumentedDataWriter<D>
      • gobblin.writer.http.AbstractHttpWriter<D>
        • gobblin.writer.http.HttpWriter<RestEntry<com.google.gson.JsonObject>>
          • gobblin.writer.http.RestJsonWriter
            • gobblin.writer.http.SalesforceRestWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Instrumentable, FinalState, DataWriter<RestEntry<com.google.gson.JsonObject>>, HttpWriterDecoration<RestEntry<com.google.gson.JsonObject>>, Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class SalesforceRestWriter
extends RestJsonWriter
    Writes to Salesforce via RESTful API, supporting INSERT_ONLY_NOT_EXIST, and UPSERT.

    • Method Detail

      • onConnect

        public void onConnect(URI serverHost)
               throws IOException
        Retrieve access token, if needed, retrieve instance url, and set server host URL A callback triggered before attempting to connect to a new host. Subclasses can override this method to customize the connect logic. For example, they can implement OAuth authentication.
        Specified by:
        onConnect in interface HttpWriterDecoration<RestEntry<com.google.gson.JsonObject>>
        Overrides:
        onConnect in class HttpWriter<RestEntry<com.google.gson.JsonObject>>
        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:
        gobblin.writer.http.HttpWriter#onConnect(org.apache.http.HttpHost)

      • onNewRecord

        public Optional<org.apache.http.client.methods.HttpUriRequest> onNewRecord(RestEntry<com.google.gson.JsonObject> record)
        For single request, creates HttpUriRequest and decides post/patch operation based on input parameter. For batch request, add the record into JsonArray as a subrequest and only creates HttpUriRequest with POST method if it filled the batch size. A callback that allows the subclasses to customize the construction of an HTTP request based on incoming records. Customization may include, setting the URL, headers, buffering, etc.
        Specified by:
        onNewRecord in interface HttpWriterDecoration<RestEntry<com.google.gson.JsonObject>>
        Overrides:
        onNewRecord in class RestJsonWriter
        Parameters:
        record - the new record to be written
        Returns:
        the current request object; if absent no further processing will happen
        See Also:
        gobblin.writer.http.RestJsonWriter#onNewRecord(gobblin.converter.rest.RestEntry)

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Description copied from class: AbstractHttpWriter
        If writer supports batch, override this method. (Be aware of failure and retry as flush can be called multiple times in case of failure @see SalesforceRestWriter )
        Overrides:
        flush in class AbstractHttpWriter<RestEntry<com.google.gson.JsonObject>>

      • processResponse

        public void processResponse(org.apache.http.client.methods.CloseableHttpResponse response)
                     throws IOException,
                            UnexpectedResponseException
        Make it fail (throw exception) if status code is greater or equal to 400 except, the status code is 400 and error code is duplicate value, regard it as success(do not throw exception). If status code is 401 or 403, re-acquire access token before make it fail -- retry will take care of rest. Default implementation where any status code equal to or greater than 400 is regarded as a failure. Processes the response
        Specified by:
        processResponse in interface HttpWriterDecoration<RestEntry<com.google.gson.JsonObject>>
        Overrides:
        processResponse in class AbstractHttpWriter<RestEntry<com.google.gson.JsonObject>>
        Throws:
        IOException - if there was a problem reading the response
        UnexpectedResponseException - if the response was unexpected
        See Also:
        gobblin.writer.http.HttpWriter#processResponse(org.apache.http.HttpResponse)
